Drug/Radiation Modality: Selumetinib (AZD6244) – targeted MEK inhibitor
Dose/Timing: Oral 25 mg/m² BID in 28-day cycles (continuous until progression):contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
Notes: NF1-associated inoperable plexiform neurofibromas (SPRINT trial); Ages 2–18; no chemotherapy or radiation:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Multi-agent chemotherapy (vincristine, corticosteroids, pegaspargase, doxorubicin, cyclophosphamide, cytarabine, 6-MP) + Nelarabine; CNS prophylactic RT
Dose/Timing: Nelarabine added in consolidation (5-day courses x2):contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}; Cranial RT 12 Gy (CNS1/CNS2) or 18 Gy (CNS3) during consolidation:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
Notes: COG Phase III for T-ALL; tested addition of nelarabine to standard ABFM regimen:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}. All patients received prophylactic cranial irradiation (higher dose for CNS3 disease):contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Multi-agent chemotherapy (same backbone as above, without nelarabine); CNS RT prophylaxis
Dose/Timing: Cranial RT per CNS status (12–18 Gy) in consolidation:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}
Notes: Control arm without nelarabine:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}. Trial showed nelarabine improved disease-free survival especially in high-risk T-ALL:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + Reduced-dose CSI (18 Gy) + focal IFRT boost + chemotherapy
Sequence: Post-op induction chemo → Radiation (reduced dose/volume) → Maintenance chemo
Dose/Timing: CSI 18 Gy + involved-field RT boost; Weekly vincristine during RT; 9 cycles maintenance chemo (cisplatin, CCNU, vincristine):contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}
Notes: COG average-risk medulloblastoma age 3–7 randomized to lower CSI (LDCSI) and involved-field RT:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}; required GTR/near GTR, M0 disease:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + Reduced-dose CSI (18 Gy) + **posterior fossa** RT boost + chemotherapy
Sequence: Induction chemo → Radiation (LD CSI, full posterior fossa) → Maintenance chemo
Dose/Timing: CSI 18 Gy + full posterior fossa  boost ~54 Gy; chemo as Arm I
Notes: Compared IFRT vs PFRT boost:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13} and low vs standard CSI in young children. Arm II: low-dose CSI + whole posterior fossa RT

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + Standard CSI (23.4 Gy) + focal IFRT boost + chemotherapy
Sequence: Induction chemo → Radiation (standard CSI, involved-field) → Maintenance chemo
Dose/Timing: CSI 23.4 Gy + involved-field boost; weekly vincristine; maintenance cisplatin/CCNU/vcr
Notes: Randomized standard vs reduced RT dosing:contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}. Arm III: standard CSI with IFRT (age 3–7):contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + Standard CSI (23.4 Gy) + posterior fossa RT boost + chemotherapy
Sequence: Induction chemo → Radiation (std CSI, full PF) → Maintenance chemo
Dose/Timing: CSI 23.4 Gy + posterior fossa to ~54 Gy; chemo per protocol
Notes: Average-risk MB age 3–7; Arm IV: standard-dose CSI + PFRT:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + Standard CSI (23.4 Gy) + involved-field RT + chemotherapy
Dose/Timing: CSI 23.4 Gy for ≥8y; boost to tumor bed; 8 cycles cisplatin-based chemo
Notes: Average-risk MB age ≥8. Older cohort only received standard-dose CSI (no low-CSI randomization):contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}; Arm V: IFRT boost

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + Standard CSI (23.4 Gy) + posterior fossa RT + chemotherapy
Sequence: Post-op RT (CSI 23.4 + full PF) → Maintenance chemotherapy
Dose/Timing: CSI 23.4 Gy; full posterior fossa boost to ~36 Gy (total ~55.4 Gy):contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}
Notes: Average-risk MB age ≥8; Arm VI: standard CSI + whole posterior fossa radiation. Trial found involved-field RT was non-inferior to whole PF:contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}; low-dose CSI was inferior for EFS:contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + CSI (36 Gy) + adjuvant chemo (vincristine/cisplatin/cyclophosphamide) **without** carboplatin or isotretinoin
Sequence: Post-op RT (standard dose CSI) with vincristine → Maintenance chemo x6 cycles
Dose/Timing: CSI ~36 Gy + boost 54 Gy (high-risk MB):contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}; cisplatin, cyclophos, vincristine maintenance ×6; **no** carboplatin or isotretinoin
Notes: COG high-risk medulloblastoma trial; baseline arm:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}. Eligibility: metastatic (M1–M4) or diffuse anaplastic MB, age 3–21:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}

Drug/Radiation Modality: CSI + concurrent **carboplatin** radiosensitization + maintenance chemo (no isotretinoin)
Sequence: Post-op RT + carboplatin (radiosensitizer) → Maintenance chemo x6
Dose/Timing: Carboplatin 35 mg/m² daily during CSI:contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}; standard maintenance chemo (cisplatin/vcr/CTX)
Notes: Experimental arm testing carboplatin during radiation:contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}. Result: Carboplatin during RT improved 5-yr EFS in Group 3 MB (73% vs 54%):contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}

Drug/Radiation Modality: CSI + standard chemo + **isotretinoin** maintenance (6–12 cycles)
Sequence: Post-op RT (no carbo) → Maintenance chemo + isotretinoin cycles
Dose/Timing: Isotretinoin 160 mg/m² orally (QOD ×12 cycles) added after chemo:contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}
Notes: Isotretinoin (13-cis-RA) added for possible anti-tumor differentiation:contentReference[oaicite:30]{index=30}. Arms C/D (isotretinoin) closed early for futility (no EFS benefit):contentReference[oaicite:31]{index=31}

Drug/Radiation Modality: CSI + carboplatin during RT + maintenance chemo + isotretinoin
Sequence: Post-op RT + carboplatin → Maintenance chemo + isotretinoin
Dose/Timing: Carboplatin during CSI; isotretinoin maintenance as above
Notes: Combined experimental arm (carbo + iso). Isotretinoin arms stopped early (futility) in 2015:contentReference[oaicite:32]{index=32}; carboplatin question continued:contentReference[oaicite:33]{index=33}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive induction chemo + autologous stem cell harvest → high-dose chemo with PBSC rescue → 3D conformal RT
Sequence: Induction (2 cycles) → Consolidation (3 high-dose chemo + stem cell transplants) → Radiation (post-chemo)
Dose/Timing: Induction: vincristine, high-dose methotrexate (5 g/m²) with leucovorin rescue, then etoposide/cyclophosphamide/cisplatin:contentReference[oaicite:34]{index=34}:contentReference[oaicite:35]{index=35}; Consolidation: 3 cycles high-dose carboplatin (approx. 500 mg/m²) + thiotepa (300 mg/m²) with PBSC rescue:contentReference[oaicite:36]{index=36}:contentReference[oaicite:37]{index=37}; 3D-CRT ~50–54 Gy to tumor bed:contentReference[oaicite:38]{index=38}
Notes: COG ACNS0333 for newly diagnosed AT/RT (atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor):contentReference[oaicite:39]{index=39} in infants/young children. **Arm I**: chemo first then delayed radiation:contentReference[oaicite:40]{index=40} (for patients <6m infratentorial, <12m supratentorial, or metastatic at any age):contentReference[oaicite:41]{index=41}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive induction chemo + stem cell harvest → **early 3D-CRT** → high-dose chemo with PBSC rescue
Sequence: Induction (2 cycles) → **Radiation** → Consolidation (3 high-dose chemo + PBSC)
Dose/Timing: Same induction as Arm I:contentReference[oaicite:42]{index=42}:contentReference[oaicite:43]{index=43}; 3D-CRT (~50 Gy) after induction:contentReference[oaicite:44]{index=44}; then 3 cycles carboplatin/thiotepa with PBSC rescue:contentReference[oaicite:45]{index=45}:contentReference[oaicite:46]{index=46}
Notes: ACNS0333 **Arm II**: radiation given immediately after induction, followed by high-dose chemo:contentReference[oaicite:47]{index=47} (for older infants: ≥6m infratentorial or ≥12m supratentorial M0):contentReference[oaicite:48]{index=48}. Trial goal: compare timing of radiation in AT/RT therapy:contentReference[oaicite:49]{index=49}

Arm: Arm I (Regimen with no HD MTX)
Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive induction chemotherapy (no high-dose methotrexate) → high-dose consolidation chemo with stem cell rescue
Sequence: Induction (3 cycles vincristine/cisplatin/etoposide/cyclophosphamide) → Consolidation (3 cycles high-dose thiotepa+carboplatin with PBSC transplant)
Dose/Timing: Induction Arm I: vincristine (d1,8,15), etoposide 5 days, cyclophosphamide 2 days, cisplatin d3:contentReference[oaicite:50]{index=50} (21-day courses ×3) with G-CSF support:contentReference[oaicite:51]{index=51}; **no** methotrexate
Notes: COG ACNS0334: Infant (<3y) medulloblastoma/PNET trial of intensive chemo ± methotrexate:contentReference[oaicite:52]{index=52}. All patients: no upfront radiation (delayed until ≥3y):contentReference[oaicite:53]{index=53}; Arm I is chemotherapy backbone CCG-99703:contentReference[oaicite:54]{index=54} without MTX

Drug/Radiation Modality: Induction chemotherapy **with high-dose methotrexate** → high-dose consolidation chemo with PBSC rescue
Sequence: Induction (3 cycles with methotrexate) → Consolidation (3 cycles thiotepa+carboplatin with PBSC)
Dose/Timing: Induction Arm II: incorporates HD methotrexate (5 g/m² d1) + leucovorin rescue:contentReference[oaicite:55]{index=55} before etoposide/cyclophos/cisplatin (given after MTX clearance):contentReference[oaicite:56]{index=56}, for 3 courses
Notes: ACNS0334 experimental arm adding methotrexate to induction for infants:contentReference[oaicite:57]{index=57}. Trial tested if HD-MTX improves EFS in <3y medulloblastoma (non-desmoplastic) – result: no clear benefit (published 2022):contentReference[oaicite:58]{index=58}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Temozolomide (TMZ) + radiation → adjuvant Temozolomide + Lomustine (CCNU) chemotherapy
Dose/Timing: Radiation: 54–59.4 Gy to tumor (brain HGG) with TMZ 90 mg/m² daily ×42 days:contentReference[oaicite:59]{index=59}:contentReference[oaicite:60]{index=60}; Adjuvant q6-week cycles ×6: CCNU 90 mg/m² (day 1) + TMZ 160 mg/m²/day ×5:contentReference[oaicite:61]{index=61}:contentReference[oaicite:62]{index=62}
Notes: COG ACNS0423 Phase II for newly diagnosed high-grade glioma (non-brainstem):contentReference[oaicite:63]{index=63}; all patients received Stupp regimen + CCNU. Adding lomustine improved 3-yr EFS vs historical TMZ-alone data:contentReference[oaicite:64]{index=64}:contentReference[oaicite:65]{index=65}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Vorinostat (HDAC inhibitor) + radiation therapy
Dose/Timing: Vorinostat 230 mg/m²/day, 5 days/week during RT (6-week course):contentReference[oaicite:66]{index=66}
Notes: COG ACNS0621 Phase I/II for DIPG (brainstem glioma) – evaluated safety of vorinostat with radiation:contentReference[oaicite:67]{index=67}. Established vorinostat dose 230 mg/m² for concurrent use

Drug/Radiation Modality: Temozolomide + Irinotecan (no bevacizumab) – chemotherapy only
Dose/Timing: Temozolomide 200 mg/m²/day PO ×5 days; Irinotecan 10 mg/m² IV ×5 days for 2 weeks (days 1–5 & 8–12):contentReference[oaicite:68]{index=68}:contentReference[oaicite:69]{index=69}
Notes: COG ACNS0821 Phase II recurrent medulloblastoma/CNS-PNET:contentReference[oaicite:70]{index=70}; Control arm TI. Objective: compare TI vs TI+Bevacizumab:contentReference[oaicite:71]{index=71}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Temozolomide + Irinotecan + Bevacizumab (anti-VEGF mAb)
Dose/Timing: Same TMZ+Irinotecan as control plus Bevacizumab 10 mg/kg IV on Days 1 and 15 of cycle:contentReference[oaicite:72]{index=72}:contentReference[oaicite:73]{index=73}
Notes: Experimental arm TIB. **Result**: Adding bevacizumab improved overall survival in recurrent medulloblastoma:contentReference[oaicite:74]{index=74} (TIB > TI) with manageable toxicity:contentReference[oaicite:75]{index=75}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Vorinostat (HDAC inhibitor) + focal radiation therapy → adjuvant chemotherapy
Sequence: Concurrent vorinostat during RT → Adjuvant maintenance (temozolomide)
Dose/Timing: Vorinostat 230 mg/m²/day on RT days:contentReference[oaicite:76]{index=76}; after RT: 6 cycles of TMZ-based chemo (e.g. TMZ 200 mg/m² ×5 q28d)
Notes: COG ACNS0822 randomized Phase II/III for newly diagnosed high-grade glioma:contentReference[oaicite:77]{index=77}. **Arm I**: vorinostat during RT. All arms received post-RT TMZ chemotherapy:contentReference[oaicite:78]{index=78}. No significant benefit seen for vorinostat arm:contentReference[oaicite:79]{index=79}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Temozolomide + focal radiation therapy → adjuvant chemotherapy
Sequence: Concurrent TMZ during RT → Adjuvant TMZ (maintenance)
Dose/Timing: TMZ 75–90 mg/m²/day during 6 weeks RT:contentReference[oaicite:80]{index=80}; adjuvant TMZ 6 cycles (200 mg/m² ×5 q28d)
Notes: Control arm (standard Stupp regimen):contentReference[oaicite:81]{index=81}. All patients got concurrent and maintenance TMZ; served as reference arm – 2-year EFS ~30% in pediatric HGG

Drug/Radiation Modality: Bevacizumab (VEGF antibody) + focal radiation therapy → adjuvant chemotherapy
Sequence: Concurrent bevacizumab during RT → Adjuvant chemotherapy
Dose/Timing: Bevacizumab 10 mg/kg IV q2 weeks during RT; after RT: 6 cycles maintenance TMZ (±Bev)
Notes: Experimental arm with bevacizumab. Trial showed no EFS/OS advantage vs TMZ alone:contentReference[oaicite:82]{index=82}:contentReference[oaicite:83]{index=83}; concurrent bevacizumab not superior:contentReference[oaicite:84]{index=84}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Maximal resection + conformal radiation + maintenance chemotherapy (VCEC regimen)
Sequence: Surgery → Radiation (immediate post-op) → Maintenance chemo ×4 cycles
Dose/Timing: Radiation: focal conformal RT (~59.4 Gy) within 31 days post-surgery:contentReference[oaicite:85]{index=85}; Maintenance chemo: 4 cycles “VCEC” – vincristine, cisplatin, etoposide, cyclophosphamide:contentReference[oaicite:86]{index=86}:contentReference[oaicite:87]{index=87}
Notes: COG ACNS0831 Phase III for newly diagnosed intracranial ependymoma (ages 1–21):contentReference[oaicite:88]{index=88}. Completely resected patients randomized to receive post-RT chemo (Arm II) vs observation:contentReference[oaicite:89]{index=89}:contentReference[oaicite:90]{index=90}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Maximal resection + conformal radiation therapy only (no adjuvant chemo)
Dose/Timing: Radiation ~59.4 Gy to tumor bed; serial MRIs for surveillance
Notes: Standard therapy arm for ependymoma: surgery + radiation alone:contentReference[oaicite:91]{index=91}. Trial is assessing benefit of adding maintenance chemo post-RT:contentReference[oaicite:92]{index=92}; preliminary results pending (as of 2025):contentReference[oaicite:93]{index=93}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Multi-agent chemotherapy + surgery (no radiation, no transplant)
Dose/Timing: Carboplatin, etoposide, cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, and vincristine per COG intermediate-risk regimen:contentReference[oaicite:94]{index=94}
Notes: COG ANBL0531 intermediate-risk neuroblastoma:contentReference[oaicite:95]{index=95}. Group 2: patients with favorable biology, <18m with certain features; therapy moderate intensity (no stem cell transplant):contentReference[oaicite:96]{index=96}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Multi-agent chemotherapy + surgery
Dose/Timing: Same drugs as Group 2, slightly intensified (additional cycles):contentReference[oaicite:97]{index=97}
Notes: Intermediate-risk neuroblastoma with less favorable features requiring more intensive chemo:contentReference[oaicite:98]{index=98}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Induction chemo → Surgery → **Single** myeloablative chemo + auto stem cell transplant → Radiation → Immunotherapy
Sequence: Induction (5 cycles) → HD chemo + transplant ×1 → RT → Anti-GD2 immunotherapy
Dose/Timing: Single transplant consolidation: high-dose carboplatin/etoposide/melphalan (CEM) ×1:contentReference[oaicite:99]{index=99}; followed by 21 Gy RT to primary; then 6 cycles dinutuximab (anti-GD2) immunotherapy
Notes: COG ANBL0532 high-risk neuroblastoma trial. Randomized tandem vs single transplant:contentReference[oaicite:100]{index=100}; Arm A = single autologous stem cell transplant:contentReference[oaicite:101]{index=101}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Induction chemo → Surgery → **Tandem** myeloablative chemo + transplants → Radiation → Immunotherapy
Sequence: Induction → HD chemo + transplant ×2 → RT → Immunotherapy
Dose/Timing: Tandem transplant: e.g. Thiotepa/cyclophosphamide then CEM regimen (2 consecutive HD chemo with stem cell rescue):contentReference[oaicite:102]{index=102}; then local RT and dinutuximab immunotherapy as in Arm A
Notes: Experimental arm with tandem autologous transplants:contentReference[oaicite:103]{index=103}. Outcome: tandem HSCT improved 3-year EFS in high-risk NBL:contentReference[oaicite:104]{index=104}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Induction chemo → Surgical resection → Single transplant → Radiation
Sequence: Induction → High-dose chemo + transplant → RT → (Arm B includes immunotherapy)
Dose/Timing: Induction per high-risk NBL; HD chemo (busulfan/melphalan) ×1; 21 Gy RT to primary
Notes: COG ANBL1531: comparing immunotherapy timing in high-risk NBL. Arm A: immunotherapy deferred (chemo/HSCT/RT only) vs Arm B: includes immunotherapy upfront

Drug/Radiation Modality: Chemotherapy (FAB/LMB96 regimen) + **vinblastine** added in consolidation phase
Dose/Timing: Standard LMB protocol for intermediate-risk NHL (cyclophosphamide, vincristine, prednisone, doxorubicin, etc.) plus vinblastine in consolidation:contentReference[oaicite:105]{index=105}
Notes: COG ANHL0131 Phase III for intermediate-risk pediatric NHL; tested adding vinblastine in consolidation:contentReference[oaicite:106]{index=106} – outcome: no EFS benefit.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Nephrectomy ± limited chemo (vincristine, dactinomycin)
Dose/Timing: Vincristine IV weekly ×10 weeks; Dactinomycin IV q3 weeks ×6 weeks:contentReference[oaicite:107]{index=107}
Notes: COG AREN0532 for low-risk Wilms tumor: 2-drug regimen, no radiation for Stage I FH tumors <550g. Excellent outcomes with surgery + vincristine/dactinomycin.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive chemotherapy + radiation (Regimen DD4A + lung RT if indicated)
Sequence: Surgery → Chemotherapy (vincristine, dactinomycin, doxorubicin) + radiation → Maintenance chemo
Dose/Timing: Week 1–6: Vincristine/Dactinomycin/Doxorubicin; flank RT 10.8 Gy (if Stage III); lung RT 12 Gy if lung mets:contentReference[oaicite:108]{index=108}; total 25 weeks therapy
Notes: COG AREN0533 for Stage III/IV favorable-histology Wilms; used 3-drug DD4A regimen with added cyclophosphamide/etoposide for slow responders. All Stage III/IV received abdominal RT:contentReference[oaicite:109]{index=109}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Post-op CSI (36 Gy) + 8 cycles chemotherapy (vincristine, cisplatin, CCNU, prednisone) **without** CSI intensification
Dose/Timing: Standard-risk medulloblastoma: CSI 36 Gy + boost 20 Gy; chemo q6wks ×8 (CCNU 75 mg/m², cisplatin 75 mg/m², vincristine):contentReference[oaicite:110]{index=110}
Notes: Children’s Cancer Group (CCG-99701) trial; compared standard vs intensified chemo in average-risk MB:contentReference[oaicite:111]{index=111}. Regimen A: conventional chemo

Drug/Radiation Modality: Post-op CSI (36 Gy) + **intensive chemo** (with stem cell support)
Sequence: Post-op RT → 3 cycles high-dose chemo + autologous stem cell rescue
Dose/Timing: After CSI 36 Gy, 3 cycles high-dose chemo (e.g. cyclophosphamide/etoposide/carboplatin) each followed by PBSC infusion:contentReference[oaicite:112]{index=112}
Notes: CCG-99701 tested feasibility of carboplatin during RT and intensive chemo:contentReference[oaicite:113]{index=113}. Regimen B was dose-intensified post-RT therapy with stem cell transplant support

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive multi-agent chemotherapy without upfront radiation
Sequence: Induction chemo (Vincristine, cyclophosphamide, cisplatin, etoposide ×4 cycles) → Second-look surgery → Consolidation chemo (cyclophosphamide/etoposide)
Dose/Timing: Cycle example: Vincristine weekly ×3, cyclophosphamide 1.5 g/m² and etoposide 100 mg/m² for 2 days, cisplatin 3 mg/kg on day 0:contentReference[oaicite:114]{index=114}; repeated every 3 weeks
Notes: CCG-99703 regimen is the chemo backbone for infant medulloblastoma/PNET (<3y) without radiation:contentReference[oaicite:115]{index=115}. Used in COG ACNS0334 as control arm; achieves ~30–40% 3-yr EFS in infants

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive induction chemotherapy (5-drug regimen) for young children
Sequence: Induction chemo cycles ×3 → Evaluate → High-dose chemo (see HSII myeloablative)
Dose/Timing: Vincristine, cisplatin, etoposide, cyclophosphamide, methotrexate (IV) – 3 cycles:contentReference[oaicite:116]{index=116}
Notes: Head Start II protocol (infants with malignant brain tumors) – three induction cycles with multiple agents before consolidation.

Drug/Radiation Modality: High-dose chemotherapy with autologous stem cell rescue
Sequence: 3 sequential high-dose chemo cycles with stem cell transplant each
Dose/Timing: Examples: Thiotepa 300 mg/m² + Etoposide 100 mg/m² ×4 days, Carboplatin 500 mg/m² ×4 days (varies by cycle) followed by stem cell infusion:contentReference[oaicite:117]{index=117}
Notes: Head Start II used 3 intensive myeloablative chemo cycles (different drug combos) with stem cell rescue instead of radiation in young children.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Similar induction as HSII (multi-agent chemo)
Sequence: Induction chemo ×5 cycles → Evaluate → HD chemo ± XRT
Dose/Timing: Vincristine, cisplatin, etoposide, cyclophosphamide (± high-dose methotrexate in select cycles)
Notes: Head Start III added a 5th induction cycle and incorporated HD methotrexate in induction for some patients, aiming to improve remission rates before transplant.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Single-cycle myeloablative chemotherapy + stem cell rescue
Sequence: One high-dose chemo cycle (carboplatin, thiotepa, etoposide) → stem cell transplant
Dose/Timing: Thiotepa 300 mg/m²/day ×3, Etoposide 250 mg/m² ×3, Carboplatin 500 mg/m² ×3, then PBSC infusion
Notes: HSIII changed to a single transplant (instead of 3) after extended induction, to reduce toxicity while maintaining efficacy.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive chemo (vincristine, cyclophosphamide, etoposide, cisplatin) **without** radiation
Dose/Timing: High-dose methotrexate-based induction plus alkylator/platinum agents; no upfront RT
Notes: St. Jude AT/RT trial (SJATRT) stratified by extent of resection and craniospinal dissemination. Stratum A: young infants with localized disease aiming to avoid radiation.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive chemo + focal radiation
Sequence: Chemo cycles → Focal RT to tumor
Dose/Timing: Chemo as per Stratum A, followed by focal RT (~50 Gy) to primary tumor
Notes: Stratum B: older patients or those needing local control; added focal irradiation to chemo.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Intensive chemo + **craniospinal** radiation
Dose/Timing: Chemo induction, then CSI ~36 Gy + tumor boost for disseminated AT/RT
Notes: Stratum C: patients with metastatic AT/RT (M+); received CSI due to high risk of neuraxis spread.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Investigational therapy (e.g. novel agent) added to upfront chemo
Dose/Timing: Experimental addition (e.g., intrathecal therapy or targeted drug) during induction
Notes: St. Jude AT/RT trial had sub-studies (B1/B2) evaluating novel interventions; B1 might denote one investigational arm.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Investigational therapy variant
Dose/Timing: As above, using a different experimental approach
Notes: B2: second experimental arm in AT/RT protocol (details specific to trial design).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Ribociclib (CDK4/6 inhibitor) + Gemcitabine
Dose/Timing: 28-day cycles: ribociclib oral daily ×21, gemcitabine IV on Days 1,8
Notes: St. Jude “DAWN” DIPG trial arms A–C with ribociclib combinations.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Ribociclib + Trametinib (MEK inhibitor)
Dose/Timing: Ribociclib daily ×21, Trametinib oral daily (continuous) in 28-day cycles
Notes: DAWN Arm B: dual targeted therapy for DIPG (CDK4/6 + MEK inhibition).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Ribociclib + Sonidegib (SHH pathway inhibitor)
Dose/Timing: Ribociclib ×21 days, Sonidegib daily (continuous) each cycle
Notes: DAWN Arm C: investigating SHH pathway inhibition with CDK4/6 inhibitor in DIPG.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + craniospinal RT + intensive chemo ± transplant
Sequence: Post-op CSI (36–39 Gy) → Chemo (maintenance or myeloablative)
Dose/Timing: High-risk MB: CSI ~36 Gy + posterior fossa boost; chemotherapy (e.g., 4 cycles with cisplatin, cyclophosphamide, vincristine, etoposide):contentReference[oaicite:118]{index=118}; some received myeloablative chemo + stem cell rescue
Notes: St. Jude Medulloblastoma-03 trial; high-risk defined by metastases or residual disease. Investigated intensive chemotherapies after CSI.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + reduced-dose CSI + chemotherapy
Dose/Timing: CSI 23.4 Gy + tumor bed boost; 4–8 cycles chemo (e.g., cisplatin, CCNU, vincristine)
Notes: SJMB03 standard-risk arm: tested reduced CSI and chemo in average-risk MB; achieved excellent survival (>80%).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + CSI 23.4 Gy + chemotherapy (average-risk non-SHH/WNT)
Dose/Timing: 23.4 Gy CSI + boost; 6 cycles chemo (cisplatin, cyclophosphamide, vincristine, etoposide); ± isotretinoin maintenance
Notes: St. Jude MB-12 protocol with molecular risk stratification. N1: non-WNT/SHH with standard clinical risk (M0 non-anaplastic).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + CSI 36 Gy + chemotherapy (intermediate risk Group3/4)
Dose/Timing: 36 Gy CSI + boost; intensive chemo similar to N1; ± isotretinoin
Notes: Stratum N2: higher risk Group 3/4 (e.g. metastases or partial resection but favorable biology).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + CSI 36 Gy + high-dose chemo + transplant
Sequence: Post-op CSI → High-dose chemo + stem cell → ±Isotretinoin
Dose/Timing: 36 Gy CSI + boost; 4 induction cycles then myeloablative chemo (thiotepa/carboplatin) + transplant; ± isotretinoin
Notes: Stratum N3: very high-risk Group 3/4 MB (metastatic/anaplastic); received tandem transplant in SJMB12 to intensify therapy.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery ± RT + chemo (low-risk SHH, e.g. infants)
Dose/Timing: If <3y: chemo-only (similar to Head Start); if ≥3y: CSI 23.4 Gy + chemo
Notes: Stratum S1: standard-risk SHH MB (no metastasis, older children may get reduced RT; infants treated with chemo-only).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + CSI + chemo (± vismodegib)
Sequence: Post-op CSI 36 Gy → Chemo ± SHH inhibitor
Dose/Timing: 36 Gy CSI + boost; maintenance with vismodegib (hedgehog inhibitor) in some cases
Notes: Stratum S2: SHH MB with risk factors (e.g. TP53-mutant SHH). Investigated targeted SHH inhibition.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + **reduced** CSI + chemo (very low-intensity)
Dose/Timing: 18 Gy CSI + limited chemo (e.g. 4 cycles vincristine/cyclophosphamide/cisplatin)
Notes: Stratum W1: WNT-subgroup MB, excellent prognosis. Trial drastically reduced RT dose to 18 Gy for these patients:contentReference[oaicite:119]{index=119}.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + CSI 23.4 Gy + chemo
Dose/Timing: 23.4 Gy CSI + chemo (standard-risk intensity)
Notes: Stratum W2: WNT MB with atypical features (e.g. >16 years old or other factors). Treated slightly more aggressively than W1.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Surgery + CSI 36 Gy + chemo
Dose/Timing: 36 Gy CSI + chemo (intensive as high-risk)
Notes: Stratum W3: rare WNT patients with high-risk features (e.g., metastatic WNT MB); given conventional high-risk therapy.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Pre-radiation chemotherapy → CSI → maintenance chemotherapy (risk-adapted)
Sequence: Induction chemo → CSI (delayed) → Maintenance chemo or transplant
Dose/Timing: Up-front chemo: 4 cycles (cisplatin, cyclophosphamide, etoposide) then CSI (depending on age: 23.4 Gy if <3, 36 Gy if older) followed by maintenance chemo
Notes: St. Jude Medulloblastoma-96 trial:contentReference[oaicite:120]{index=120}; tested delaying radiation with induction chemo in young children vs immediate RT. Long-term results helped refine infant therapy:contentReference[oaicite:121]{index=121}

Drug/Radiation Modality: Everolimus (mTOR inhibitor) + BEV (bevacizumab) for recurrent DIPG
Dose/Timing: Everolimus PO daily + Bevacizumab IV q2 weeks; 28-day cycles
Notes: PNOC003: phase I/II trial in recurrent DIPG combining mTOR inhibition with anti-VEGF therapy.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Panitumumab (EGFR mAb) + everolimus + irinotecan for recurrent gliomas
Dose/Timing: Panitumumab IV q2wks, everolimus daily, irinotecan IV q2wks (on 28-day cycle)
Notes: PNOC007: tested multi-agent biologic therapy in children with recurrent high-grade gliomas.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Lenalidomide (immune-modulator) + radiation for DIPG
Dose/Timing: Lenalidomide PO daily during 6 weeks of RT (dose escalated)
Notes: PBTC-026: Pediatric Brain Tumor Consortium trial for DIPG, examining safety of lenalidomide with radiation:contentReference[oaicite:122]{index=122}.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Cilengitide (integrin inhibitor) + radiation for DIPG
Dose/Timing: Cilengitide IV bi-weekly during 6 weeks RT (dose escalation)
Notes: PBTC-027: phase I DIPG trial targeting angiogenesis (integrin αvβ3/β5).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Vorinostat + radiation for DIPG
Dose/Timing: Vorinostat PO 5 days/week during RT (6 weeks)
Notes: PBTC-030: tested histone deacetylase inhibition in newly diagnosed DIPG (similar to COG ACNS0621).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Modified regimen: Radiation + bevacizumab + temozolomide ± irinotecan (DIPG)
Dose/Timing: Standard 54 Gy RT with concurrent TMZ ± irinotecan, Bev added
Notes: PBTC-033: pilot study for DIPG combining multiple agents with radiation (inspired by adult GBM protocols).

Drug/Radiation Modality: Paxalisib (PI3K/mTOR inhibitor) for DIPG
Dose/Timing: Paxalisib daily continuously (28-day cycle), dose-escalation
Notes: PBTC-045: investigational targeted therapy trial in DIPG post-radiation.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Nivolumab (PD-1 inhibitor) + panobinostat (HDAC inhibitor) for DIPG
Dose/Timing: Nivo IV q2wks + Panobinostat PO 3x/week (every 28-day cycle)
Notes: PNOC013: multi-arm DIPG trial testing nivolumab combinations.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Nivolumab + everolimus (mTOR inhibitor) for DIPG
Dose/Timing: Nivo IV q2wks + Everolimus daily (28-day cycles)
Notes: PNOC013 arm evaluating PD-1 blockade with mTOR inhibition in DIPG.

Drug/Radiation Modality: BFM-style multi-agent chemo (no cranial radiation, CNS prophylaxis only)
Dose/Timing: Standard BFM regimen (Prednisone, Vincristine, Doxorubicin, Cyclophosphamide, high-dose Methotrexate, Cytarabine, 6-MP) for disseminated NHL:contentReference[oaicite:123]{index=123}
Notes: CCG-A5971 for disseminated (Stage III/IV) lymphoblastic lymphoma (CNS-negative); Regimen B1 similar to BFM backbone without cranial irradiation:contentReference[oaicite:124]{index=124}

Trial ID: Induction → Consolidation → Maintenance (with intensified CNS treatment)
BFM chemotherapy plus intrathecal therapy and cranial irradiation ~18 Gy for CNS-positive disease
Lymphoblastic NHL (Stage IV with CNS involvement) received cranial RT in addition to systemic chemo (Regimen B2).
CV chemotherapy (Cyclophosphamide + Vincristine) for standard-risk Hodgkin
3 cycles chemo → low-dose involved field RT
Cyclophosphamide 800 mg/m² + Vincristine on Days 1,8 (alternating with ABVD for other arms); 15 Gy IF-RT
COG A9952 early-stage Hodgkin trial; Regimen A had minimal chemotherapy (CV) and low-dose radiation for favorable patients.
ABVD (Adriamycin, Bleomycin, Vinblastine, Dacarbazine) ×4 → IF radiation
Standard arm for intermediate risk Hodgkin in A9952.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Radiation + Bevacizumab

Trial ID: 54 Gy focal RT; Bev 10 mg/kg IV q2 weeks during RT
St. Jude “DIPG-BATS” trial: tested adding bevacizumab to radiation.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Radiation + Bevacizumab + Erlotinib (EGFR inhibitor)

Trial ID: Erlotinib PO daily during RT (85 mg/m²); Bev as above

Drug/Radiation Modality: Radiation + Bevacizumab + Erlotinib + Temozolomide

Trial ID: TMZ 75 mg/m² during RT + 6 cycles 200 mg/m² adjuvant; Bev+Erlotinib as above

Drug/Radiation Modality: Radiation + Bevacizumab + Temozolomide

Trial ID: TMZ given concurrently and adjuvantly; Bev during RT only
Tested if TMZ (standard chemo) adds benefit with Bev.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Gemcitabine + Oxaliplatin chemotherapy (recurrent tumors)

Trial ID: Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m² IV Day 1,8; Oxaliplatin 100 mg/m² Day 1
GemPOx used for recurrent high-grade gliomas or ependymomas as salvage.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Difluoromethylornithine (ornithine decarboxylase inhibitor)

Trial ID: Polyamine depletion strategy – studied in recurrent neuroblastoma and diffuse glioma maintenance.

Drug/Radiation Modality: Multi-agent intensive chemotherapy + high-dose methotrexate (infant ETMR)

Trial ID: Induction chemo (with HD MTX) → Consolidation high-dose chemo + transplant
Regimen similar to infant medulloblastoma protocols (vincristine, MTX, etoposide, cyclophosphamide, carboplatin; then thiotepa-based HD chemo)
Experimental protocol for embryonal tumor with multilayered rosettes (ETMR) aiming to improve survival with intensive chemo.
